biography.bio: Oda Yuji's career in Japanese entertainment began in the late 80s when he released two record singles that went largely unnoticed. He also played supporting roles in a few films and tv shows. Yuji began to garner attention when he appeared in a 1989 tv romantic comedy called "Mama Haha Boogie", opposite Atsuko Asano (101st Marriage Proposal, Abunai Keiji). But it was not until his appearance in the television mini series Tokyo Love Story (1991) in 1991, however, that he became a celebrated star. Since then Yuji has continued to produce the occasional album but has become most known for his impressive acting. Probably his best known role is as the married-to-the-job cop in Odoru daisosasen (1997) and its various incarnations on tv and film. Yuji's hobbies include shooting pool, diving and racing cars in Japan's Class C circuit.
biography.name: Yûji Oda

biography.bio: Hitomi Kuroki was born on October 5, 1960 in Fukuoka, Japan as Akiko Egami. She is an actress and director, known for Dark Water (2002), Souvenirs de Marnie (2014) and Lost Paradise (1997).
biography.name: Hitomi Kuroki

biography.bio: Both of Ken Watanabe's parents were teachers: his mother taught general education and his dad taught calligraphy. He became interested in acting at the age of 24 when a director of England's National Theatre Company, where he was studying, told him that acting was his special gift. Ken is mostly known in Japan for playing samurais. He incorporates the samurai's values in his daily life by not amassing too many material possessions and by living his life with honor, pride and discipline. The Last Samurai (2003), the film that introduced him to Western audiences, was his fourth film released in 2003, and he has also starred in roles as a gangster, a businessmen and a general. Ken is currently separated from his wife and has two children, a daughter who is working as a model and one son.
biography.name: Ken Watanabe

biography.bio: Bing Shao was born on February 15, 1968 in Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China. He is known for his work on The Myth (2005), Red River Valley (1997) and The Lost Bladesman (2011).
biography.name: Bing Shao

biography.bio: Chang-min Son was born on April 24, 1965 in Pusan, South Korea. He is an actor, known for The Medical Brothers (1997), All That Falls Has Wings (1990) and Silver Stallion (1991).
biography.name: Chang-min Son

biography.bio: Mutsumi Fujita is an actress, known for Ashura-jô no hitomi (2005), Blind Beast vs Dwarf (2001) and Neji-shiki (1998).
biography.name: Mutsumi Fujita

biography.bio: Masatô Ibu was born on March 28, 1949 in Nakano, Tokyo, Japan as Satoru Murota. He is an actor and writer, known for Empire of the Sun (1987), Gohatto (1999) and Sway (2006).
biography.name: Masatô Ibu

biography.bio: Hayato Ichihara was born on February 6, 1987 in Kawasaki, Japan. He is an actor, known for All About Lily Chou-Chou (2001), Rainbow Song (2006) and God's Puzzle (2008).
biography.name: Hayato Ichihara

biography.bio: Masayuki Imai was born on April 21, 1961 in Hyogo, Japan. He was an actor and writer, known for Shizukana seikatsu (1995), Winds of God (1995) and Tokyo Mafia (1995). He died on May 28, 2015 in Tokyo, Japan.
biography.name: Masayuki Imai

biography.bio: Renji Ishibashi was born on August 9, 1941 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Audition (1999), Bird People in China (1998) and Dead or Alive (1999).
biography.name: Renji Ishibashi

biography.bio: Kazuhiko Kanayama was born on August 16, 1967 in Osaka, Japan. He is an actor, known for Dr. Akagi (1998), Another Lonely Hitman (1995) and Inamura Jên (1990). He was previously married to Miyoko Yoshimoto.
biography.name: Kazuhiko Kanayama

biography.bio: Shunsuke Matsuoka was born on February 27, 1972 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor and director, known for 800 Two Lap Runners (1994), Freeze Me (2000) and Bastoni: The Stick Handlers (2002).
biography.name: Shunsuke Matsuoka

biography.bio: Yutaka Matsushige was born on January 19, 1963 in Fukuoka, Japan. He is an actor, known for The Solitary Gourmet (2012), Ringu (1998) and Last Life in the Universe (2003).
biography.name: Yutaka Matsushige

biography.bio: Isao Natsuyagi was born on December 25, 1939 in Adachi-ku, Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for The Land of Hope (2012), Day of Resurrection (1980) and De l'eau tiède sous un pont rouge (2001). He died on May 11, 2013 in Kamakura, Kanagawa, Japan.
biography.name: Isao Natsuyagi

biography.bio: Tetsurô Tamba was born on July 17, 1922 in Tokyo, Japan as Shozaburo Tanba. He was an actor and writer, known for You Only Live Twice (1967), Harakiri (1962) and Le royaume des chats (2002). He was married to Hoki. He died on September 24, 2006 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Tetsurô Tamba
